name: launch_socket_server
description: Bind to privileged ports without running a server as root

repo.name: launch_socket_server
repo.description: Bind to privileged ports on OS X without running your server as root

readme.summary: Excellent technical documentation with clear problem statement and comprehensive configuration examples, but lacks troubleshooting guidance and could use a simpler quick-start example.
readme.top_issue: No troubleshooting section covering common issues like permission errors, socket conflicts, or debugging connection problems

injection_risks.description: The programName variable is used to construct a command that is executed using exec.Command, which can lead to command injection attacks if the input is not properly sanitized.
The programArgs variable is used to construct a command that is executed using exec.Command, which can lead to command injection attacks if the input is not properly sanitized.

critical_findings: Lack of input validation for programName and programArgs
security.summary: The launch_socket_server package has several security concerns, including command injection vulnerabilities and lack of input validation, which could lead to unintended behavior or attacks.

concerns: No commits in over 3.5 years (last commit June 2022)
Zero active contributors in past 6 months
No merged PRs in past 6 months
No closed issues in past 6 months
Unknown last release date suggests extended inactivity
Open issue with no recent activity indicates unresponsiveness
positive_signals: Project exists on Homebrew (was officially packaged)
Open issue exists (at least one person cared enough to report)
maintenance.summary: This project is abandoned with over 3.5 years of inactivity, no recent maintenance activity, and no active contributors.

analysis_summary.doc_summary: The documentation is thorough and well-structured, but could benefit from a clearer quick start section and more troubleshooting information.
concerns: No commits in the past six months
Only one merged PR in the past six months
Security: Command injection vulnerability in exec.Command
Security: Lack of input validation for programName and programArgs
Security: The programName variable is used to construct a command that is executed using exec.Command, which can lead to command injection attacks if the input is not properly sanitized.
Security: The programArgs variable is used to construct a command that is executed using exec.Command, which can lead to command injection attacks if the input is not properly sanitized.
highlights: Two contributors have been active in the past six months
